page.title: 04OLD ROAD SYSTEMS
page.content: At this time,Hagley had no post office.Letters were brought by a postwoman from Stourbridge,and twice a week,a carrier took parcels and passengers to Birmingham. Most original Hagley houses stood near the crossing of the road linking Stourbridge and Bromsgrove to Halesowen. No road from the{Forge {Garage}to the main A458 roundabout existed.The garage was then the site of a blacksmith's shop,and next to it was a{cattle market}which usually opened on Mondays. As the Stourbridge road neared the market,one turned left to Halesowen,or straight on to Kidderminster, via the{Lyttelton {Arms.}At this junction was a drinking fountain, which was moved in 1929 to a piece of waste ground opposite the traffic island,near to the{War {Memorial.
